page.title: 16Another Extract From 1945 1b
page.content: NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 researched by Sarah Probert People did not go on holiday very much then,and if they did it would only be Barry or Porthcawl,some people would go out to Kent the country on working holidays.They would stay in the farmhouse,and go out picking the farmers crops and at the end of the day he would pay them. We never went on holiday because there were too many of us,my eight brothers and sisters,my mother and father and me.We would spend all our money on food and clothing.My father worked down the pit and brought home around Â£2.00 a week which was considered poor money.He didn't bath in the pit he came home dirty and would bath
